skillTree.localised_description: Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.localised_description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fateweaver may harness the Winds of Magic to his best advantage, for he already knows all the possible outcomes of his actions.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Though all who serve the Changer are gifted with additional protection from attack, some can restore it to maximum effectiveness faster than others.
The unstoppable magician can draw the Winds to him and bind them for protection more easily than other practitioners of the craft.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn

skillTree.localised_description: Kairos' scribes faithfully record every baleful whisper that passes his lips, that they be made real, in the form of the Daemonic Horrors that do his bidding.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +20% for Iridescent Horrors
	(all characters)

Hero recruit rank: +3 for Iridescent Horrors
	(factionwide)

Attribute: Causes Terror for embedded Iridescent Horror Heroes
	(all armies factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Of all the gifts bestowed by the Dark Powers upon their followers, the boons of Tzeentch are surely the most desirable.

effects.description:
Barrier: +20% for Lord of Change units
	(Lord's army)

Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Lore of Tzeentch spells
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Enchantments such as these may be strengthened further by those with the requisite magical skill.

effects.description:
Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds for Iridescent Horrors, Cultists and Lords of Change
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.
When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.
When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.
When two or more units in the same army share this attribute,  intensity increases the power of spells cast.

skillTree.localised_description: Every possible future blazes with the light of sorcery and change.

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the first group of common spells
Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the second group of common spells

skillTree.localised_description: To see the future is to know which tools can most efficiently enforce the fickle whims of Tzeentch.

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the first group of uncommon spells

skillTree.localised_description: To know the future is to understand the true futility in mortal flailings against fate.

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the second group of uncommon spells

skillTree.localised_description: "I could tell you of your defeat this day, but your future has already arrived. So let us meet it together, you and I."

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the first group of rare spells

skillTree.localised_description: Infinite pasts lead to this point, where the foe is destroyed utterly in service of futures pleasing Tzeentch numbering nine times nine.

effects.description: Unlocks the Fragments of Sorcery slot for the second group of rare spells

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
"From creation, beget destruction."

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Lores of Life, Metal, Light and Heavens spells
Winds of Magic cost: -25% for Lores of Life, Metal, Light and Heavens spells

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: "In the unknowable now, ruminate."

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Lore of Tzeentch spells

skillTree.localised_description: "From potential, beget change."

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Lores of Death, Beasts, Shadows and Fire spells
Winds of Magic cost: -25% for Lores of Death, Beasts, Shadows and Fire spells

skillTree.localised_description: Though blind to the present, Kairos can look into the future and begin weaving spells far in advance, layering multitudinous slivers of power for just the right moment.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though they may appear ridiculous, the whirling, screeching footsoldiers of the Great Conspirator are the iron in his feathered martial glove.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +6% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Barrier: +4% for Marauders of Tzeentch, Tzaangor, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +9% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Barrier: +7% for Marauders of Tzeentch, Tzaangor, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Although it can be said that they have failed His tests, the broken minds and fluctuating, mutated bodies of Tzeeneth's lesser minions still have their uses.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Unburdened by mass, Tzeentch's flaming servants surge toward the foe – the heralds of their utter doom, no less.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +3% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Range: +5% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +7% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The thundering of their Chaos Steeds and chariots announces the arrival of Kaldour's dread Knights, and death is never far behind them.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +8% for Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12% for Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +18% for Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: For the Winged Watchers and Doomstriders of this world, their very lack of identifiable corporeal form shall be their armour against attack.

effects.description:
Armour: +6 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the bravest, most rational souls waver in the hideous, laughing face of their worst nightmares.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for Marauders, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Warshrines, Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Marauders, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Warshrines, Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Of the many weapons available to Tchar, derangement must surely be the greatest and most satsifying to wield.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +7% for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change, Soul Grinder units, Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +5 for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change, Soul Grinder units, Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 10% for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change, Soul Grinder units, Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The flickering beings of flame are in many ways the purest servants of the Changer, for their gaseous forms are ever in a state of flux.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 10% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The best form of defence is attack, and the best form of attack is the one which reaches into the foe's mind and turns its contents against them.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 10% for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
The many faces of the Wind-lord are described here, along with all the terrible mysteries of destiny. Between these lines lurks insanity, ever waiting to trap the unwary.
Those who cannot think clearly and lucidly are unable to resist the insidious creep of Ruin.
Surprise is half the battle. The other half is pure, unadulterated terror in the face of certain madness.
Having effected Change upon one's enemies, what next for the Mocking Watcher? More of the same, naturally, for to do so over and over again brings the sweetest of raptures.

effects.description: Changing of the Ways cooldown: -1 turns
Changing of the Ways cooldown: -2 turns
Changing of the Ways cooldown: -3 turns

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of Change, though it may amount to nothing more than the cruellest of tricks, ensures the forces of Tzeeneth are fed and nourished.
When you know all there is to know, as does Kairos, nothing is beyond the reach of your grasp.

effects.description: Changing of the Ways cost: -33% for "Track Army" and "Reveal Shroud"

skillTree.localised_description: Who pays the piper? Why, Fateweaver's opponents, of course, with their minds and souls as coins of currency.
Tzeentch knows that at their cores all beings desire Change, and as such there are no shortage of recruits willing to march under his many-coloured banner.

effects.description:
Daemons Reforged: +3% chance for destroyed Daemons of Tzeentch units to be restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

Daemons Reforged: +6% chance for destroyed Daemons of Tzeentch units to be restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

Daemons Reforged: +10% chance for destroyed Daemons of Tzeentch units to be restored after battle
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

factionEffects.localised_description: Kairos sits at Tzeentch's right hand, stirring the stygian depths of the Well as he whispers aloud the secrets that only he can see.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +5 per turn
	(all armies)
Magic item drop chance from battle: +5%

Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: Kairos lives apart from the flow of time. Thus, he does not easily succumb to ill-fortune, for fate can easily be altered if one has the proper knowledge.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Cultists
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The now is trivial to us – we know the day we perish is not this day."

effects.description: Uses Fragments of Sorcery to construct his own spell lore between battles
